p.span: The most interesting of all. The problematic button hit is the third late one. It is the closing hit for the green sequence where it is determined not to invoke onMultiHit since it is late. It resets multiHitCount to 0 and the next button hit forms a new blue
sequence. However. the user might want to quickly try again after a failed multi-hit sequence attempt like in the red sequence. In this case, the problematic hit becomes an extra button to push.

div.font:
Note:
We define a press as when the button is pushed down. A release is when the button is let go. A hit is a press and then a release.
Debouncing is used to read the stable state of the button as it mechanically bounces around the contacts when hit.
A callback is a function which the user can define to run when the library detects valid button events.
